intro: Corytholoma douglasii var. verticillatum, commonly known as the Douglas's corytholoma, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its distinctive, whorled arrangement of leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
